get.description: Finds all calls sent or received by the user. Use "id=0" for the campaignId parameter to query for all calls sent through the POST /calls API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Comma seperated list of call ids to query for.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Query for calls inside of a particular campaign.

parameters.name: fromNumber
parameters.description: E.164 number that calls are from

parameters.name: toNumber
parameters.description: E.164 number that calls are to

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for a specific call

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Expected call statuses in comma seperated string (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT)

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: Expected call results in comma seperated string (SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED)

parameters.name: inbound
parameters.description: Is the call inbound, false for outbound

parameters.name: intervalBegin
parameters.description: Start of the find interval in Unix time milliseconds

parameters.name: intervalEnd
parameters.description: End of the find interval in Unix time milliseconds

post.description: Use the /calls API to quickly send individual calls. A verified Caller ID and sufficient credits are required to make a call.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Specify a campaignId to send calls quickly on a previously created campaign

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Array of CallRecipient objects

post.x-request-cURL: curl -u username:password -H "Content-Type:application/json" -X POST -d '[{"phoneNumber":"12135551100","liveMessage":"Why hello there!"},{"phoneNumber":"12135551101","liveMessage":"And hello to you too."}]' "https://api.callfire.com/v2/calls"

get.description: Find all voice broadcasts created by the user. Can query on label, name, and the current running status of the campaign. Returns a paged list of voice broadcasts.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of voice broadcast

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of voice broadcast

parameters.name: running
parameters.description: Specify if the campaigns should be running or not

This is a live answer text to speech recording","liveSoundId":64,"machineSoundText":"This is an answering machine text to speech recording","machineSoundId":65}],"totalCount":1}

post.description: Create a voice broadcast campaign using the Voice Broadcast API. Send a CallBroadcast in the message body to detail a voice broadcast campaign. A campaign can be created with no contacts and bare minimum configuration, but contacts will have to be added further on to use the campaign.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Specify whether to immediately start this campaign (not required)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: callBroadcast

post.x-request-cURL: curl -u username:password -H "Content-Type:application/json" -X POST -d '{"name":"Example API Call Broadcast","fromNumber":"12135551189","recipients":[{"phoneNumber":"2135551133"}],"answeringMachineConfig":"AM_AND_LIVE","liveSoundText":"Hello! This is a live answer text to speech recording","machineSoundText":"This is an answering machine text to speech recording"}' "https://api.callfire.com/v2/calls/broadcasts"

This is a live answer text to speech recording","liveSoundId":64,"machineSoundText":"This is an answering machine text to speech recording","machineSoundId":65}

post.summary: Add batches to a call broadcast
post.description: The add batch API allows the user to add additional batches to an already created voice broadcast campaign. The added batch will go through the CallFire validation process, unlike in the recipients version of this API. Because of this, use the scrubDuplicates flag to remove duplicates from your batch. Batches may be added as a contact list id, a list of contact ids, or a list of numbers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the voice broadcast

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request

post.summary: Add recipients to a call broadcast
post.description: Use this API to add recipients to an already created voice broadcast. Post a list of Recipient objects for them to be immediately added to the voice broadcast campaign. These contacts do not go through validation process, and will be acted upon as they are added. Recipients may be added as a list of contact ids, or list of numbers.

parameters.description: The id of the voice broadcast to update

post.description: Use this API to create a sound file via a supplied string of text. Send the required text in the TextToSpeech.message field, and pick a voice in the TextToSpeech.voice field. Available voices are: MALE1, FEMALE1 , FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1

parameters.description: textToSpeech

get.description: Find all contact lists for the CallFire Developer. Returns a paged list of contact lists.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name or partial name of contact list

post.description:
Creates a contact list for use with campaigns using 1 of 3 inputs. A List of Contact objects, a list of String E.164 numbers, or a list of CallFire contactIds can be used as the data source for the created contact list. 
After staging these contacts into the CallFire system, contact lists go through seven system safeguards that check the accuracy and consistency of the data. For example, our system checks if a number is formatted correctly, is invalid, is duplicated in another contact list, or is on a specific DNC list. The default resolution in these safeguards will be to remove contacts that are against these rules. If contacts are not being added to a list, this means the data needs to be properly formatted and correct before calling this API.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request

post.description: Create a contact list for use with campaigns through uploading a .csv file

post.description: With the verification code received from the Create endpoint, a call to this endpoint is required to finish verification. An example would be with a code of 1234 post a body of {"verificationCode":1234} to this API.

get.x-response:
{"items":[{"number":"12135551100","configType":"IVR","ivrInboundConfig":{"dialplanXml":"<dialplan name="Root">
	
	<setvar varname="pin">0</setvar>
	<setvar varname="account_id">false</setvar>
	<setvar varname="recording_sent">false</setvar>
	
    <menu maxDigits="10" timeout="10000">
		<setvar varname="recording_sent">false</setvar>
		<play name="enter_pin_prompt" type="tts" cache="true">Enter your pin number</play>
		<keypress pressed="Default">
		    <setvar varname="pin">${call.lastinput}</setvar>
			<play type="tts" cache="true">authenticating</play>
               <post varname="account_id">http://localhost:8080/callfire-api-impl/authentication/call-in/?pin=${call.lastinput}&callId=${call.id}</post>
               <if expr="isNaN('${account_id}')">
                   <play type="tts" cache="true">Couldn't find that pin</play>
                   <goto>enter_pin_prompt</goto>
               </if>				
               <!-- start recording thing with the press 1 to review 2 to send 3 to start again -->
               <menu maxDigits="1" timeout="3500">
                   <play name="record_prompt" type="tts" cache="true">Record after the beep. Press pound when done.</play>
                   <record name="record" varname="recording" />
                   <play name="recording_options" type="tts">Listen to recording, press 1. Save recording, press 2. Record again, press 3.</play>
                   <keypress pressed="1">
                       <play type="url" cache="false">${recording}</play>
                       <goto>recording_options</goto>
                   </keypress>
                   <keypress pressed="2">
                       <!-- Should we handle an error response here by sending logs and letting the user know?? -->
                       <setvar varname="recording_sent">true</setvar>
                       <play type="tts">Recording Saved. It will be available shortly.</play>
                   </keypress>
                   <keypress pressed="3">
                       <goto>record</goto>
                   </keypress>
               </menu> 
		</keypress>
	</menu>
	
</dialplan>
"}},{"number":"13025178999"}],"limit":100,"offset":0,"totalCount":2}

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

post.description: Purchase keywords. Send a list of available keywords into this API to purchase them using CallFire credits. Be sure the account has credits before trying to purchase.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request

post.description: Purchase numbers. There are many ways to purchase a number. Set either tollFreeCount or localCount along with some querying fields to purchase numbers by bulk query. Set the list of numbers to purchase by list. Available numbers will be purchased using CallFire credits owned by the user. Be sure the account has credits before trying to purchase.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request

get.description: Returns a single NumberOrder instance for a given order id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of order

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

get.description: Finds all texts sent or received by the user. Use "id=0" for the campaignId parameter to query for all texts sent through the POST /texts API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: List of text ids to query for

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Query for texts inside of a particular campaign.

parameters.name: fromNumber
parameters.description: E.164 number that text was from

parameters.name: toNumber
parameters.description: E.164 number that text was sent to

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of the text message

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Expected text statuses in comma seperated string (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT)

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: Expected text results in comma seperated string (SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED)

parameters.name: inbound
parameters.description: Specify true if inbounds, false if outbounds. Do not specify for both.

parameters.name: intervalBegin
parameters.description: Start of the find interval in Unix time milliseconds

parameters.name: intervalEnd
parameters.description: End of the find interval in Unix time milliseconds

post.description: Use the /texts API to quickly send individual texts. A verified Caller ID and sufficient credits are required to make a call.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Specify a campaignId to send calls quickly on a previously created campaign

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: textRecipients

get.description: Find all text autoreplies created by the user. Returns a paged list of TextAutoReply.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: E.164 number that contains a TextAutoReply

get.x-response: {"items":[{"id":4,"match":".*","message":"Short code reply. Echo - ${text.message}!"},{"id":15,"number":"67076","keyword":"CALLFIRE","message":"I am a leaf on the wind"}],"limit":100,"offset":0,"totalCount":2}

post.description:
Auto-replies are text message replies sent to a customer when a customer
 replies to a text message from a campaign. A keyword will need to have been purchased 
 before an Auto-Reply can be created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: textAutoReply

post.x-request-cURL: curl -u username:password -H "Content-Type:application/json" -X POST -d '{"number":"67076","keyword":"CALLFIRE","message":"I am a leaf on the wind"}' "https://api.callfire.com/v2/texts/auto-replys"

get.description: Returns a single TextAutoReply for a given text auto reply id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text auto reply

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

get.x-response: {"id":15,"keyword":"CALLFIRE","message":"I am a leaf on the wind"}

delete.description: Deletes a text auto reply and removes the configuration. Can not delete a TextAutoReply currently active on a campaign.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text auto reply

get.description: Find all text broadcasts created by the user. Can query on label, name, and the current running status of the campaign. Returns a paged list of text broadcasts.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of text broadcast

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of text broadcast

parameters.name: running
parameters.description: Is broadcast running

get.x-response: {"items":[{"id":3,"name":"Outbound SMS Broadcast","status":"FINISHED","lastModified":1443333295000,"fromNumber":"67076","localTimeRestriction":{"enabled":false},"retryConfig":{"maxAttempts":1,"minutesBetweenAttempts":60,"retryPhoneTypes":["FIRST_NUMBER"]},"message":"This is a text broadcast","bigMessageStrategy":"DO_NOT_SEND"},{"id":13,"name":"Example API SMS","status":"STOPPED","lastModified":1443380774000,"fromNumber":"12135551100","localTimeRestriction":{"enabled":false},"retryConfig":{"maxAttempts":1,"minutesBetweenAttempts":60,"retryPhoneTypes":["FIRST_NUMBER"]},"message":"Hello World!"}],"totalCount":2}

post.description: Create a text broadcast campaign using the Text Broadcast API. Send a TextBroadcast in the message body to detail a text broadcast campaign. A campaign can be created with no contacts and bare minimum configuration, but contacts will have to be added further on to use the campaign.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: If true then start campaign immediately.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: textBroadcast

get.description: Returns a single TextBroadcast instance for a given text broadcast id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

put.description: After having created a text broadcast campaign, this PUT lets the user modify the configuration of a text broadcast campaign. See TextBroadcast for more information on what can/can't be updated on this API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: textBroadcast

put.x-request-cURL: curl -u username:password -H "Content-Type:application/json" -X PUT -d '{"name":"Example API SMS updated","message":"a new test message"}' "https://api.callfire.com/v2/texts/broadcasts/13"

post.description: Archive a text broadcast

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast to archive

get.summary: Find batches in a text broadcast
get.description: This endpoint will enable the user to page through all of the batches for a particular text broadcast campaign.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

post.summary: Add batches to a text broadcast
post.description: The add batch API allows the user to add additional batches to an already created text broadcast campaign. The added batch will go through the CallFire validation process, unlike in the recipients version of this API. Because of this, use the scrubDuplicates flag to remove duplicates from your batch. Batches may be added as a contact list id, a list of contact ids, or a list of numbers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request

post.summary: Add recipients to a text broadcast
post.description: Use this API to add recipients to an already created text broadcast. Post a list of Recipient objects for them to be immediately added to the text broadcast campaign. These contacts do not go through validation process, and will be acted upon as they are added. Recipients may be added as a list of contact ids, or list of numbers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: textRecipients

post.description: Start a text broadcast

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast to start

get.description: Return text broadcast statistics

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

post.description: Stop a text broadcast

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of text broadcast to stop

get.summary: Find texts in a text broadcast
get.description: This endpoint will enable the user to page through all of the texts for a particular text broadcast campaign.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of text broadcast

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0.

get.description: Returns a single Text instance for a given text id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the text

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields returned. E.g. fields=id,name or fields=items(id,name)

contactNumbersField.description: Type of phone number (homePhone, workPhone, mobilePhone)

status.description: Status of batch (NEW, VALIDATING, ERRORS, SOURCE_ERROR, ACTIVE)

intervalStart.description: Start of usage period formatted Unix time

intervalEnd.description: End of usage period formatted in Unix time

remainingPlanCredits.description: Remaining credits rounded to nearest whole value associated with a plan

remainingPayAsYouGoCredits.description: Remaining pay as you go credits rounded to nearest whole value

attributes.description: Map of string attributes associated with action

state.description: State of action (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, DISABLED, FINISHED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT)

batchId.description: Id of batch associated with action

finalCallResult.description: Result of call (LA, AM, BUSY, DNC, XFER, NO_ANS, XFER_LEG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED, SD, POSTPONED, ABANDONED, SKIPPED)

lastModified.description: DateTime formatted in unix time *read only*

toNumber.description: E.164 number to call to record sound

whisperSoundId.description: Id of sound file, played if call is screened

verificationCode.description: The code used to verify a caller id number

status.description: Status of sound (UPLOAD, RECORDING, ACTIVE, FAILED, ARCHIVED, SCRUBBED)

externalId.description: External id of contact for syncing with external sources

externalSystem.description: External system that external id refers to

properties.description: Map of string properties for contact

status.description: Status of contact list (ACTIVE, VALIDATING, IMPORTING, IMPORT_FAILED, ERRORS, DELETED, PARSE_FAILED, COLUMN_TOO_LARGE)

contactNumbersField.description: Type of phone number (homePhone, workPhone, mobilePhone)

dialplanXml.description: Xml to be used for IVR

leaseBegin.description: Lease begin formatted in unix time *read only*

leaseEnd.description: Lease end formatted in unix time *read only*

autoRenew.description: Toggle auto renewal of keyword lease at end of each billing cycle

status.description: Lease status (PENDING, ACTIVE, RELEASED, UNAVAILABLE) *read only*

leaseBegin.description: Lease begin formatted in unix time *read only*

leaseEnd.description: Lease end formatted in unix time *read only*

autoRenew.description: Toggle auto renewal of keyword lease at end of each billing cycle

status.description: Lease status (PENDING, ACTIVE, RELEASED, UNAVAILABLE) *read only*
Status of order (NEW, PROCESSING, FINISHED, ERRORED, VOID, WAIT_FOR_PAYMENT)

tollFreeCount.description: Total count of toll-free numbers requested

localCount.description: Total count of local numbers requested

lata.description: Local access and transport area of requested numbers

attributes.description: Map of string attributes associated with recipient

lata.description: Local access and transport area of region

minutesBetweenAttempts.description: Number of minutes between retry attempts

retryPhoneTypes.description: Phone types to retry (FIRST_NUMBER, HOME_PHONE, WORK_PHONE, MOBILE_PHONE)

attributes.description: Map of string attributes associated with action

state.description: State of action (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, DISABLED, FINISHED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT)

batchId.description: Id of batch associated with action

finalTextResult.description: Result of text (SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED)

number.description: E.164 number for text auto reply

match.description: Case insensitive text to match, if left empty will match all texts

message.description: Message to return as auto reply

lastModified.description: DateTime formatted in unix time *read only*

bigMessageStrategy.description: If message too big (SEND_MULTIPLE, DO_NOT_SEND, TRIM)

attributes.description: Map of string attributes associated with recipient

textResult.description: Result of text (SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED)

voice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1 , FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1)

message.description: Text to be used to turn into sound
